roleset.name: come about, arise

role.descr: location where something develops, or thing that was there first and undergoes some sort of change as new elements develop from it

example.name: develop-v: Intransitive / Inchoative-- new annotation of theme
example.text: A problem developed .

example.name: develop-v: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: A balance must be ensured between nature conservation and economic development so that Taiwan may develop into a sustainable green silicon island .

propbank.arg: into a sustainable green silicon island

example.name: development-n: autogen1
example.text: the development of cancer and other problems in the daughters ofwomen who took the drug

propbank.arg: in the daughters ofwomen who took the drug

example.name: development-n: because this develops on its own
example.text: the development of a vigorous private sector

example.name: development-n: with MNR
example.text: the European TV industry 's sluggish development .

example.name: development-n: both args
example.text: the tumor 's development in salivary glands in rats .

example.name: development-n: both args in PPs
example.text: the development of tumors in animals after inoculation with tumor cells

example.name: development-n: both args, arg2 POSS
example.text: his development of a condition believed to be autism .

propbank.arg: of a condition believed to be autism

example.name: developed-j: arg2
example.text: Because his consciousness is not very developed , the child can tolerate it , otherwise he would die .

example.name: developed-v
example.text: The patient has sigmoid colon cancer that has developed liver metastases
example.amr: (c / cancer-03 :ARG1 (p / patient-yy) :ARG2 (a / anatomical-site :name (n2 / name :op1 "sigmoid" :op2 "colon")) :ARG1-of (d / develop-01 :ARG2 (d2 / disease-disorder :pl + :name (n5 / name :op1 "metastasis") :location (a3 / anatomical-site :name (n4 / name :op1 "liver")))))

roleset.note: DEVELOP-V NOTES: Updated by Julia (after much discussion) to address the weird 'location as subject' issue and inconsistancy in the annotation of theme. See Examples and VN.Member of Vncls appear-48.1.1, occurrence-48.3. (from develop.01-v)
DEVELOPMENT-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls occurrence-48.3, appear-48.1.1. (from development.01-n)
DEVELOPED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, develop-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls appear-48.1.1, occurrence-48.3. (from developed.01-j)

roleset.name: create, having been intentionally grown, built up

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 being developed, if in addition to arg1

example.name: develop-v: transitive-1
example.text: UCLA developed a new promoter gene

example.name: develop-v: ARG0 and ARG2 and ARG1
example.text: He predicts that in one to two years , biochips will be suitable for use in supplemental tests , and after around three years for high - throughput screening ; in five years time it should be possible to develop them into general screening tools which will be as easy to use as the pregnancy test kits on the market today .

propbank.arg: into general screening tools which will be as easy to use as the pregnancy test kits on the market today

example.name: develop-v: with benefactive
example.text: Bill Gates developed DOS for Microsoft

example.name: develop-v: with secondary predication
example.text: Albert M. Kligman developed Retin - A [ to combat acne ]

example.name: develop-v: with secondary predication
example.text: Albert M. Kligman developed Retin - A for combating acne .

example.name: develop-v: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: But what is covered under the rubric of developing the knowledge - based economy ?

example.name: development-n: with arg-1
example.text: new - product development

example.name: development-n: intentional real-estate development
example.text: development of a well off Texas ' Matagorda Island where it found gas in 1987

propbank.arg: of a well off Texas ' Matagorda Island where it found gas in 1987

example.name: development-n: with LOC
example.text: foreign development ventures

example.name: development-n: with beneficiary, arg3
example.text: the development of a product for a customer

example.name: development-n: with args 1, 2 and 4
example.text: the development of a product from sketches or drawings to being a manufactured entity .

example.name: development-n: args 1 and 5
example.text: Other developments that contributed to the economic development of southwest Louisiana after 1880 were :

example.name: developed-j: with CXN
example.text: China is decades from being as developed as the US , regardless of the amount of money they have - China s greatest compromise is time .

roleset.note: DEVELOP-V NOTES: Member of VNcls build-26.1, grow-26.2. (from develop.02-v)
DEVELOPMENT-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls build-26.1, grow-26.2. (from development.02-n)
DEVELOPED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, develop-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls build-26.1, grow-26.2. (from developed.02-j)

The following structures should be used in all cases, even when it feelslike the Arg1 and the purpose clause (secondary predicate) are veryclosely linked and feel like they should be a single argument.Treebank is inconsistent in it treatment of these; sometimes it'ssplit into two nodes, sometimes there's a single node holding both.If we are consistent in dividing these arguments, it's relatively easyfor someone else to merge them. The reverse is not true. (from develop.02-v)

This frame differs from develop.02 in that arg4 is no longer "attribute/secondary predicatation" (the args that appeared to cover may be coverd by argms such as PRP, it turns out, and will probably not occur here in their own nodes anyway), but is now a final product, as final products separate from arg1 showed up in several examples. (from development.02-n)
